title: Continuing Medical Education (CME) and Change Management Strategies: Project-Based Practical Application

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical field knowledge and understanding of workplace environments
context.additional_context: Learners, working in medical administration and management roles, analyze organizational change management and CME program implementation. Through real-world scenario-based projects, they predict change barriers and develop response strategies.

learning_goals: Participants can accurately identify three or more barriers (e.g., time, habits, peer opposition) that may arise when implementing the change plan presented in the CME program.
Through project-based learning, participants design change management strategies and develop at least one actionable implementation plan applicable to real work environments.
Participants can validate the feasibility of their change management strategies and derive improvement points through peer assessment and summative evaluation.

resources: Project management templates (e.g., Gantt chart, SWOT analysis)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
